settings.title: THE MOST RESEARCHED INSOLES IN THE WORLD
VKs provide a “spring-like” effect to improve shock absorption and reduce the load and stress on the athlete’s body.
settings.dialog_content:
Whether walking, running or jumping, athletes experience ground reaction forces (GRF)

Athletes experience significantly less GRF with VKTRY Insoles (10%), especially once the athlete was fatigued.

This indicates that VKs were able to absorb more shock and distribute the ground forces more evenly for the athlete.

settings.title: VKs improve alignment to protect your knees from injuries.
settings.dialog_content:
The knee is considered especially vulnerable in the lower extremity kinetic chain. VKs decreased frontal plane knee joint excursion (lateral movement) with test subjects.

Less joint excursion equates to improved alignment during running and reduces abnormal knee joint load.

Even a small variation in knee alignment can result in stress on the ligaments and degenerative damage to the knee.

settings.title: VKs provide added stability and protection for the ankle joint, increase energy efficiency and protect against shin splints.
settings.dialog_content:
VKTRY Insoles allows the athlete to decrease the degree of dorsiflexion (loading up) in order to perform the necessary work in plantar flexion (push-off)

This allows the tibialis anterior tendon to work less thereby reducing the chances of shin splints, tibial stress syndrome and anterior compartment syndrome.

VKs allow the athlete to “load up” at the ankle less… yet generate more force. Essentially… less risk, more reward.

settings.title: VKs reduce the risk of ankle injuries and increase protection against plantar fasciitis (currently 4M cases per year in the U.S.)
settings.dialog_content:
VKs reduced the degree of ankle plantarflexion necessary for running test subjects to exert a measured ground force.

VKs better control ankle eversion (rolling) resulting in improved joint stability reducing the risk of ankle injury.

By decreasing ankle excursion (lateral movement), VKs keeps the bones & joints of the foot within the normally accepted range of motion resulting in reduced stress on the Plantar Fascia.

settings.title: THOUSANDS OF ATHLETES
settings.subtitle: AT OVER 500 PRO AND COLLEGE TEAMS USE VKS

settings.question: How do I know VKTRY Insoles will fit my shoes?
settings.answer: VKTRY Insoles fit true to size. If you are a size 9 shoe, order a size 9/9.5 insole. VKTRY takes into account that some sports shoes fit more tightly (cleats, spikes). That's why we also ask for the sport you are playing. If any problems with fit once you receive your VKs, simply contact us and we will arrange for a free exchange. We get the size right about 98% of the time!

settings.question: Why do I need to enter my sport?
settings.answer: Different shoe types fit differently. For example, soccer shoes fit much more tightly than basketball shoes. We accommodate for these differences by having different foam cushions: yellow is 7mm thick, black is 5mm and red is 3mm. Because of this, it may be difficult for an athlete who plays multiple sports to move their VKs from a loose fitting shoe to a tighter fitting shoe.

settings.question: How are VKTRY Insoles customized for each athlete?
settings.answer: VKTRY Insoles are designed to be highly personalized based not only on shoe size, but also based on sport and body weight. VKs come in 5 levels of flexibility because a bigger athlete generates more ground force than a smaller athlete.

settings.question: Do VKTRY Insoles come in different widths or arch types?
settings.answer: No, we do not make VKs in different widths or arch types. They have been designed to be arch agnostic and our sizes are very generous in the width. Our VKs fit most foot types and sizes, but if any issues with comfort after trying, please contact us.

settings.question: If I am on the border of a weight level, should I go up or down?
settings.answer: We usually recommend going down. The weight level is a big factor in determining the VK’s Pro Level (flexibility). While a higher Pro Level may provide more spring, it’s very important that you are able to comfortably flex your feet for the insoles to be effective.

settings.question: If I sometimes wear a 9.5 shoe size and in other shoes wear a 10, what size VK should I order?
settings.answer: We recommend that you select the shoes you will be wearing your VKs in the most and choose that shoe size when selecting your VK size. Any issues with fit, please contact us and we can arrange an exchange.

settings.question: What is VKTRY’s warranty policy?
settings.answer: We offer a 90-day Money Back Guarantee. If you are not satisfied with your VKs, please email us at info@vktrygear.com along with your full name and/or order number and what you did not like about the VKs. With international returns, the customer will be responsible for shipping the VKs back to our office. We strive to make all VKTRY customers, happy customers!

settings.question: Do you offer product exchanges?
settings.answer: Yes, about 5-10% of the time, we may need to alter the size or flexibility of the VKs you ordered. We try our best to ensure you get what you need. Please send us an email at info@vktrygear.com with your full name and order number along with the issue and we will get back to you with procedures on exchanging your VKs. We offer free exchanges within the USA. However, international customers will be responsible for shipping costs.

settings.question: Still have questions?
settings.answer: Visit our FAQ page to learn more, and if you still have any questions contact us at info@VKTRYgear.com or 1-844-468-5879.
